description: {"blocks":[{"key":"foiia","text":"This protocol describes the generation and amplification/indexing of tagmented libraries from freshly isolated nuclei for bulk ATACseq. It is adapted from Buenrostro et al., 2015, PMID: 25559105.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kdsu","text":"Quantitate libraries using the Qubit DNA High Sensitivity Assay, and check library distribution by running the DNA High Sensitivity Assay on an Agilent Bioanalyzer. A typical trace is shown below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a18v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2r8pl","text":"Pay attention to the presence of any primer dimers, which will appear at ~50-80 bp. These can occupy space on the flow cell and reduce the number of useful reads generated from a sequencing run. If primer dimers are present (even at low levels), perform another 1.8x cleanup using AMPure XP beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kmq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EBAF05D0A74911ECA717A15722918245","height":293,"id":218918,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8ac94","text":"Note the nucleosomal laddering pattern, which corresponds to nucleosome-free, mononucleosomal, dinucleosomal, and trinucleosomal fragments enriched at ~200, 350, 550, 750bp, respectively.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"atac.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3i86jn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3g86jn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3h86jn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3f86jn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfu4a","text":"If multiplexing samples, first perform a balancing run to ensure equal representation of all samples in the pool. For the balancing run, prepare an \"equal volume\" pool by combining   each library together. Run the pool on a MiSeq instrument using a MiSeq Reagent Kit Nano. Based on the proportion of reads assigned to each index during the Nano run, prepare a balanced pool that will yield an equal read depth for all samples in the pool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":181,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"24a6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"ACC6AC90A74B11ECA717A15722918245","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eosm1","text":"Prior to submitting for sequencing, quantitate the pool using the Qubit High Sensitivity DNA assay. Determine the average fragment size for each library from the Bioanalyzer traces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66q0g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"39k9g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtcgh","text":"Determine the average fragment size in the balanced pool, and use the following formula to determine the nM concentration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bkms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2n446","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cr5ec","text":"Submit the pool to your sequencing facility, noting the nM concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a43bp","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h0ms","text":"For HuBMAP bulk ATAC-seq samples, the multiplexed pool was sequenced on a NovaSeq 6000 S4 lane using a 100bp paired-end run configuration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgk9c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9t6n8","text":"Tip: set a region from 200bp to 1000bp in the region table tab (fragments over ~1kb don't cluster efficiently on the flow cell) and the Agilent software will calculate the average fragment size.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3DCC6040A74C11ECA717A15722918245","height":112,"id":218922,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"image.jpeg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3n86jn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3k86jn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3m86jn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx3j86jn.webp","width":527}}}}
